sessions.title: Sessions
sessions.agentStartingMessage: The AI agent is starting up. This may take up to 2 minutes. Please wait...
sessions.createSessionToStart: Create a new session to start chatting with AI agents

home.title: Welcome to Remote SWE Agents
home.description: Remote SWE Agents allows you to collaborate with AI-powered software engineers to help with your projects.

cost.title: Cost Analysis
cost.description: Analyze the usage costs and token consumption of AI agents
cost.costBreakdownDescription: Detailed cost breakdown by session and model

new_session.title: New Session
new_session.heading: Start a New Conversation with AI Agent
new_session.description: Creating a new session will launch a dedicated worker and enable real-time conversation with AI agents.
new_session.initialMessagePlaceholder: Enter your initial message to the AI agent...

api_keys.title: API Keys
api_keys.description: Manage API keys for accessing agent functionality programmatically
api_keys.createApiKeyDescription: Create an API key to access the agent through the API
api_keys.keyCreatedDescription: Make sure to copy your API key now. You won't be able to see it again.
api_keys.confirmDeleteDescription: Are you sure you want to delete this API key? This action cannot be undone.
api_keys.deleteSuccessDescription: The API key has been successfully deleted.

prompt_settings.title: Prompt Settings
prompt_settings.description: Configure the system prompt that is sent to the AI agent
prompt_settings.configDescription: This prompt is added to the system prompt sent to the AI agent for every conversation.
prompt_settings.placeholder: Enter additional system prompt instructions here...

api_docs.title: API Documentation
api_docs.description: Learn how to use the API to interact with AI agents programmatically. First, create an API key in the settings.
api_docs.authenticationDesc: All API requests require an API key to be passed in the `x-api-key` header.

sessions.title: Sessions
sessions.createSessionDesc: Create a new agent session with an initial message:
sessions.createSessionReturns: Returns a workerId that can be used to send additional messages:
sessions.sendMessageDesc: Send a follow-up message to an existing session:
sessions.sendMessageNote: Replace :sessionId with the workerId returned when creating the session.
sessions.exampleSendMessage: Send a message to an existing session:
